reviewText: When I got the dvd in the mail, I quickly popped it in. This dvd took me back to the concert that changed my life. I knew of Slayer and liked them somewhat, but after witnessing them play live and there landmark cd in full- I was floored. Ive heard live Slayer, and this has to be one of his best performances. The way it was taped, is a little annoying but its still a excellent concert. Probably the best dvd concert you can find, it was that good.

reviewText: the show was on July 11th 2004 in Augusta Maine and all i have to say was it RULED. all us metal heads in maine REALLY deserved this. (seeing how NO ONE comes to maine) i'm amazed that they actually came up here in the middle of f***ing nowhere. oh well, the show opened with God Forbid, than Hatebreed, Slipknot, and the best for last: SLAYER!!! i wasn't under the impression slayer were going to play the entire Raining Blood album, and actually have it RAIN BLOOD on stage. i was suprised, and in aww when it did. best show ever. i also got to hang out with Byron from GF, and he autographed a poster for me.

reviewText: Slayer has still got it, and never lost it.  One of the most influential bands of 80's metal scene shows in this DVD that an album done right the first time is one that stands the test of time.  Slayer effortlessly shreds through the guts of all ten tracks of the original album, with all lights, thunder, smoke, and of course, BLOOD!!!! This DVD also has some behind the scenes footage and bonus live tracks from the show.  If you must own one DVD from slayer, this is it.
summary: What can one say, easy five star edition to any metalheads collection

Title: N/A

reviewText: Those words - spoken by Kerry King as he comes off stage at the end of this concert - are an apt summation. Not only are the brutal power, breathtaking speed, and dazzling precision of Slayer in live performance all on display, you have as a set list what is widely considered the greatest metal album in history.Those of us who were around when "Reign in Blood" came out in 1986 are getting old enough to be careful about how vigorously we bang our heads. ("Ow, my neck!") Naturally, that includes the band members. Poor Dave Lombardo occasionally looks like he's going to have a heart attack. Yet somehow they still deliver this epic assault. I don't know how they do it. Maybe they really did sell their souls to the Devil!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I thought the Warfield DVD concert was good but Still Reigning is just fantastic. The band sound at the top of their game. Even Tom seems to have gotten his voice back after the somewhat uneven performance in places on the Warfield DVD. The director and producer have done an outstanding job shooting the footage and capturing the audio.This DVD also puts right the main sin of the Warfield DVD - the dreadful "Fans Rule" documentary. Still Reigning gives us what we deserve - a real, genuine interview and profile of the band. All four of them get their due, instead of just Kerry shouldering the load. They come across as intelligent, well-spoken guys. I wish that interview was a bit longer. A full hour would have been great.I think the Warfield and Still Reigning together give you a good collection of live Slayer - and that's what it's all about.
Title: N/A

reviewText: In all honesty, this thing would have been worth the 5 stars easily, but it just really bugs me that it's incomplete.  My rating is more like4.5 stars.  If you didn't know, 5 songs are missing.  I also do not like the way that it's set up, I feel that the concert should have been shown in it's entirety from start to finish, not start off with Angel of Death and then set up the earlier songs as bonus material.  If it was played in its entirety, then it wouldn't seem as flat as it does.  Don't get me wrong, this thing would definitely be 5 stars from me, only if they presented the concert the way they should have.  I mean, wouldn't anyone love to see Hell Awaits or At Dawn they sleep Played here?  We get to see segments of the missing songs here and there on Slayer in their Own Words, but it just doesn't satisfy me.  And to answer any questions, yes Tom's voice is great here, unlike the War at the Warfield DVD.  Well maybe the missing songs is in return for it being as cheap as it is, heck I got it for $10.  The only real flaws in the show that bugs me is that Tom misses his mark to sing a segment in Alter of Sacrifice, and Jeff misses the downpour of blood, but I'm not complaining about those.Anyways here is the complete track listing for the show.1. Disciple*2. War Ensemble3. Hallowed Point4. Necrophiliac5. Spill the Blood6. Fight till Death*7. Payback*8. Dead Skin Mask*9. Mandatory Suicide10. Hell Awaits*11. South of Heaven12. Angel of Death13. Piece by Piece14. Necrophobic15. Alter of Sacrifice16. Jesus Saves17. Criminally Insane18. Reborn19. Epidemic20. Postmortem21. Raining Blood*concert songs not on DVDIf you are a Slayer fan, get this.  If you haven't been to one of their concerts before, this will certainly want to make you go.  Slayer is definitely taking the thrown back as the gods of Thrash, and I can hardly wait for the next album.

reviewText: All you hard core Slayer fans know how important this is! To see Dave Lombardo back is the greatest gift! As a drummer myself for over 25 yrs. I will say Dave is, pound for pound the best ever...period. As the years have gone by I felt he would never go back. If you are an original Slayer fan from back in the 80's you would be a fool to not get this. First off, you get to see and hear the ORIGINAL line up back together again. Secondly, you get to see and hear the entire Reign In Blood album played live. The thing that I was surprized by was the musicianship going on here. They still play just as fast and almost note for note to the original 1986 LP. The bonus features on this dvd are really great too. The Slayer documentary is REALLY great on this. New interviews with the band talking about the project and Dave's return. Also the bonus area has a few extra live tracks.

reviewText: Slayer are the kings again , after "war at the warfield" wich didnt seem to show that much energy they take back the throne and make their own , track by track "still reigning" recreates this time in visual terms the legendary album "reign in blood" with the same sound and ferocity and intensity you can hear in this album but this time you can put an image to this songs this guys take back youth from the past and they look in very good shape , Lombardo (back with the band) is yet a tornado with drums as in times when he was younger , Araya still can pronunciate dozens of words in seconds and headbang like a maniac, Hanneman keeps playing his guitar with amazing velocity, and King plays his riffs like no other human being can (now that sadly Dimebag Darrel is gone), final cut (reign in blood of course) end with a especial blood rain effect that falls over the stage and the four Slayer members, creating an apocaliptic finnale that drives the audience insane and madness is the main emotion in the final picture, really is something to recognize how this band have keep loyal to trash metal after all this years , their integrity is unquestionable and this is the only way to reach inmortality in heavy metal History , they are survivors and definitelly they deserve to be the kingsHM

reviewText: From [...]Slayer has released a great new DVD entitled "Still Reigning". There are a couple of stand out points to this release which follows the recent "War At The Warfield" of last year. For starters this is the first official release that will feature original drummer Dave Lombardo who has rejoined the band as a permanent member since 2003. With no offense to Paul Bostaph, Slayer is at is metal best with Dave on the skins. There is a DVD included in the career expansive boxed-set "Soundtrack To The Apocalypse" but not everyone is going to spend $100 in order to get it (I recommend they do however). The second stand out piece is the fact that the album "Reign In Blood" is performed from start to finish. Many people regard this as a seminal piece in the Slayer catalog. They are not wrong in that for this is the home of not only the title track, but also "Piece By Piece" as well as "Angel Of Death" and many more.Those that attended the "Jaegermeister Music Tour 2003" will remember that "Reign In Blood" was performed as the encore to the bands set. Since I attended these shows, I found it to be a pretty excellent treat for all of the fans. The only difference from those nights is that during the climax of this DVD, the band is drenched in blood that pours down upon them and covers the players and the instruments. It is an intense visual as only you would expect from a band like Slayer.While one of my criticisms of the DVD is the fact that they did not include the entire performance from the shows and I am guessing that this was avoided in order to have this DVD to be different from the "War" DVD. The bonus songs featured on the DVD were actually performed at the beginning and it would have been nice to perhaps see a couple of the recent videos they had done. "Reign In Blood" is performed to its perfection and it is excellent to see the original lineup in their most brutal fashion. Slayer while a band best experienced live, is still able to give you an example of what to expect in this DVD. Fans of the genre will not be disappointed at these masters of the craft.
summary: Celebrate The Reign Of Metals Kings !!!!

reviewText: The film is of good quality: images alter between black & white and color, the angles are diverse, the stage lights and effects (blood rain) are great without being pretentious. First there is the entirety of Reign in Blood, then six more songs from their 80's catalog. The sound quality is good, you can hear what each one of them is doing. I especially like how Slayer have aged: retained crucial elements of their sound and image, without becoming parodies of themselves. I was surprised at how this DVD was priced. I would have loved a longer set in the bonus tracks, but for the quality and the price, I can't really complain. Oh and the interviews with the band members are cool. very informative, but not too long either.a must buy for metal fans in general!

reviewText: Thrash pioneers Slayer have been known for years as being one of the best live acts, well, ever.  Reign in Blood: Still Reigning finds the legendary band playing their entire landmark 1986 album "Reign in Blood" live from beginning to end, which in itself is reason enough alone to pick this DVD up.  Besides all ten cuts from "Reign in Blood", some other live staples are thrown in like "Mandatory Suicide" and "War Ensemble" to boot, and of course, there's the blood soaked conclusion to the concert which is pure Slayer all the way.  There are some interviews as well which are a more than welcome inclusion, and the band sounds and plays great (it's great to see original drummer Dave Lombardo back in the fold), while the video quality is solid and the crowd is more than into it.  All in all, Still Reigning sums up just what the heavy metal pioneers are doing today, and this DVD is an absolute must own for any and every Slayer fan.

Title: N/A

reviewText: Alright, first off, it's Reign In Blood live in it's entirety, no song omitted, all on high quality DVD, that alone is worth the price sticker on this baby.  These guys zoom through the setlist pretty quickly, playing every song flawlessly.  It is so awesome watching them play Necrophobic, just listen to the speed of that song!  The sound and camera quality is as good as it gets.  There are many different camera angles.  The show they put on was incredible.  Lots of flashing lights, and the grand finale during Raining Blood where the stage actually rains blood on all of the band members!Not only do you get that, but they throw in quite a few other classic crowd favorates as extra.  You also get War Ensemble, Hallowed Point, Necrophiliac, Mandatory Suicide, Spill The Blood, and South Of Heaven.  All of which are done exceedingly well.Lastly, you get an interview with the band entitled Slayer In Their Own Words.  Not one member is left out on this one, nor one topic.  They discuss anything from the in and outs of Dave Lombardo to how Slayer came about to the hostility of the fans.  It's all covered in a very short but sweet manner.Slayer fans, do yourself a favor and pick this one up!

reviewText: Awesome band, and a Nice DVD: Great Sound, great picture, as well as one of the best finishing sets I have seen since GWAR (you'll see what I mean)Anyway, my only MINOR complaint is that the audience didn't seems as thrilled as slayer did about going through the entire album. Fans where not as active on some songs and had that look of "when are they going to play my song." On their faces...or "what song is this" maybe it was a more mainstream slayer crowd...any show I ever scene them at (which I have seen them about 5 times live) their audience was way more aggressive than this one on EVERY song. As a matter of fact, the first time I seen slayer in upstate NY I seen 7 people taken out in stretchers....Anyway. Great DVD...support metal and buy this!

reviewText: I just saw Slayer a few nights ago in Sayreville, NJ and they were awesome. I was hoping to see the entire Reign in Blood album performed live but they did not do that instead they had a set list that was like the one on War at Warfield. The concert footage and audio on this DVD is great. However, the video is non-Anamorphic unlike War at Warfield that was Anamorphic. I assume that Universal had something to do with this since they were involved in this release unlike the War at Warfield release. I have deducted two stars for the non-Anamorphic transfer. Anamorphic transfer have been the industry standard for a couple of years so it makes no sense why Univeral would provide us with a letterbox non-Anamorphic transfer.
summary: Great concert and audio but not Anamorphic
Title: N/A

reviewText: Still Reigning.For the simple fact of Dave Lombardo being here makes this DVD worth the pocket change to pick up.Many other reviewers have covered the contents. Its great to have Reign in Blood in its entirety live. What makes it for me though is the bonus tracks. Those just completely add to the kick-assness of the DVD. War Ensemble, South of Heaven, Mandatory Suicide, Necrophiliac, Spill the Blood and Hallowed Point are the extras. Included also is a succinct documentary.Its nice to hear them all say having Dave back is a great thing.The video looks great and is presented in widescreen. Sound quality is also excellent.Its not a full set like War at the Warfield. However, for it what is this DVD is absolutely kick-ass.That would be my minor critisicm that there isn't more tunes in the extras. I would've loved to have some cuts of the Bustoph era.Thats a minor gripe though. For the bucks, you can't beat this DVD. It showcases the Slayer us oldschoolers love.Now, lets get the new Slayer album out!
summary: The best and most brutal metal band shine with Dave behind the kit.

reviewText: The whole 'Reign In Blood' album performed live with Dave back on drums.........damn I've been waiting for this for a long while. The songs are played a bit slower and the band is not as tight as I would have thought but.......the original line-up hasn't played live in over a decade. The sound is great and the end performance of Reigning Blood is amazing...what a bloody outcome...haha. There is extra live tracks from both SOH and SITA which add even more to this reunion. Also behind the scenes interviews with band members....so cool. And what a great price.....a huge bargain.A must have for all slayer fans!!!
summary: That's right Dave Lombardo is back into the fold.......Hooray!!!!!

reviewText: Slayer performed an entire set dedicated to their landmark album Reighn in Blood from start to finish where towards the end blood starts raining on the stage covering the band in blood.The result is amazing and I wish like hell I could have been there.Slayers legendary status is forged in determination and for over 20 years they have never wavered or strayed from making the most aggresive and uncomprimising music in the heavy metal world.They are kings on the verge of god-like status.As other bands of their era rose and fell and trends passed Slayer pushed ahead.Even when for a time in the 90's people kind of forgot about them and their original drummer left they continued on keeping their heads held high.Now with Dave Lombardo back in the fold and metal entering yet another golden era Slayer are once again being given the respect they deserve.This dvd aside form the amzing concert footage also contains a small retrospective of Slayer by each of the band members which is really really cool because you allmost never ever hear a thing about these guys ever so to hear frm their own mouths on their own terms makes this dvd a classic.BUY THIS NOW!!!!!!!
Title: N/A
